meanings.definition: To pass close to a celestial body in order to alter the course of a spacecraft.
meanings.sent1: The spacecraft will swingby the moon to change its path.
meanings.sent2: The probe will swingby Jupiter to gain speed for its journey.
meanings.sent3: The spaceship decided to swingby the asteroid for a quick boost.
meanings.sent4: The satellite will swingby Earth, using its gravity to slingshot forward.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut planned to swingby Mars to adjust the spaceship's route.

meanings.definition: A maneuver in which a spacecraft passes close to a celestial body in order to alter its course.
meanings.sent1: The swingby of Venus helped the spacecraft change direction.
meanings.sent2: The mission included a swingby of Saturn to adjust the trajectory.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected swingby of Mercury caused a slight course correction.
meanings.sent4: The planned swingby of Pluto was crucial for the mission's success.
meanings.sent5: The swingby of Neptune was a highlight of the space exploration journey.

meanings.definition: A method of using the gravitational pull of a celestial body to alter the trajectory of a spacecraft.
meanings.sent1: The swingby of the comet helped the spacecraft change its path.
meanings.sent2: The spacecraft's swingby of the sun was carefully calculated.
meanings.sent3: The swingby of the asteroid provided a gravitational boost to the probe.
meanings.sent4: The planned swingby of the moon was essential for the mission's success.
meanings.sent5: The spacecraft's swingby of Jupiter was a critical part of the mission.
